item.title: The U.S. Department of Commerce and Chainlink are partnering to bring U.S. government macroeconomic data on-chain.
item.description: August 28th. As per official information, the U.S. Department of Commerce is collaborating with Chainlink to place U.S. government macroeconomic data on the blockchain. These novel Chainlink data feeds will safely offer crucial U.S. economic data on the blockchain, encompassing Real Gross Domestic Product (Real GDP), Personal Consumption Expenditures Price Index (PCE Price Index), and Real Final Sales to Private Domestic Purchasers.

item.title: JPMorgan: Bitcoin Volatility Hits Historic Low, Price Undervalued Compared to Gold
item.description: August 28th - According to Coindesk, JPMorgan Chase stated in a research report that Bitcoin is considered to be too inexpensive when compared to gold because its volatility has reached a historical low. The report pointed out that Bitcoin's six-month rolling volatility has decreased from nearly 60% at the start of the year to approximately 30% currently, which constitutes a new low. With volatility approaching that of gold, Bitcoin's current volatility is only twice that of gold, also representing the lowest ratio in history. JPMorgan Chase believes that this makes Bitcoin increasingly appealing to institutional portfolios.Based on volatility-adjusted calculations, Bitcoin's market capitalization would need to increase by 13%, with a price of around $126,000, in order to be in line with gold's $5 trillion private investment scale. According to the bank's model, Bitcoin is currently undervalued by approximately $16,000 compared to gold, indicating potential upward movement.

item.title: The U.S. is planning to put GDP data on the blockchain, aiming to span across 9 blockchains
item.description: On August 28th, as reported by Bloomberg, the United States intends to place GDP on the blockchain and aims to cover 9 blockchain networks.

item.title: U.S. Data Strength Puts Pressure on Rate Cut Expectations
item.description: August 28th. The price of U.S. short-term Treasury bonds witnessed a slight downward movement. This was because the strong U.S. economic growth and employment data somewhat weakened the market's perception that the Federal Reserve would cut interest rates twice by the end of the year. The U.S. second-quarter economic growth rate was revised from 3% to 3.3%, surpassing the expectations of economists. After the release of this data, the yields on two to five-year U.S. Treasury bonds increased by at least two basis points to reach a daily high. Meanwhile, the initial jobless claims experienced a greater-than-expected decline, which is a significant signal for the labor market.Sudra Rajappa, the U.S. Rate Strategist at Natixis, stated, "The data continues to indicate that despite trade uncertainties, consumers still maintain resilience." item.title: Federal Reserve Board Member Cook Sues Trump, Protesting His Dismissal of Her Fed Position
item.description: August 28th: Based on market information, Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook has filed a lawsuit against US President Trump to object to his dismissal of her from the Federal Reserve post. (FXStreet)

item.title: CRO Surges Over 61% in 24 Hours, Currently Trading at $0.377
item.description: On August 28th, based on market data, CRO surged by more than 61% in the past 24 hours and is currently trading at $0.377.BlockBeats previously reported that on August 26th, Yorkville Acquisition Corp, Trump Media & Technology Group, and Crypto.com announced that the three parties had signed a definitive agreement to merge and form Trump Media Group CRO Strategy, Inc., a digital asset treasury company focused on acquiring the native cryptocurrency (CRO) of the Cronos ecosystem. The expected composition of the digital asset treasury includes: $1 billion in CRO, $200 million in cash, $220 million in cash-settled mandatory convertible notes, and a $5 billion equity commitment from the Yorkville-affiliated entity YA II PN, Ltd. This structure will make it the first and largest publicly traded CRO treasury company.

item.title: IMF: Market Still Trusts Fed Independence, But Real Risks Should Not Be Ignored
item.description: August 28th. During this week earlier on, US President Trump made an attempt to remove Fed Governor Powell. This has raised concerns regarding the government's reshaping of the Fed's leadership and the push for rate cuts. The First Deputy Managing Director of the IMF, Georgieva, commented on the relatively calm market by stating: "Obviously, the market still has faith in the Fed's independence in setting monetary policy rates. In particular, operational independence is expected to be preserved. I think the actual situation is more worrying than what the market is currently demonstrating at present, but we still need to wait and observe." (FXStreet)

item.title: Binance CEO: The Core of the Cryptocurrency Industry in the Next Decade Lies in User Adoption
item.description: On August 28th, Richard Teng, the CEO of Binance, stated, "In the coming decade, the core of the crypto industry is user adoption. We are moving from 'whether to adopt' to 'how to adopt', and this transformation is occurring on a large scale."

item.title: Binance Enhances Trading Service with Addition of Liquidity Provider Aggregation
item.description: On August 28th, as per official information, Binance has completed the full upgrade of its trading services, which now incorporates a Liquidity Provider Aggregation feature.This service aggregates over-the-counter quotes from the largest liquidity provider network in the industry for both spot and options. It focuses on internalizing order flow in order to reduce market impact, thereby offering tighter spreads, faster execution, and more competitive quotes for large cryptocurrency trades.
